  • Method Details

    • multiscaleMedianTransform

      public void multiscaleMedianTransform(GreyscaleImage input, List<GreyscaleImage> outputTransformed, List<GreyscaleImage> outputCoeff)
      A computationally expensive multiscale median transform. see the pyramidal mean transform multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform(...) instead. This method has a runtime complexity of n_iter * O(N_pixels * lg2(windowArea)) where windowArea grows from 1 to 2*2*lg2(imageDimension) + 1 and nIter = lg2(imageDimension).
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -
      outputCoeff -

    • reconstructMultiscaleMedianTransform

      public GreyscaleImage reconstructMultiscaleMedianTransform(GreyscaleImage c0, List<GreyscaleImage> mmCoeff)

    • multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2

      public void multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2(GreyscaleImage input, List<GreyscaleImage> outputTransformed, List<GreyscaleImage> outputCoeff)
      pyramidal median transform (faster than multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform but reconstruction from coefficients is not exact, so prefer multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform(...) if exact is needed); following pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -
      outputCoeff -

    • multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2

      public void multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2(GreyscaleImage input, List<GreyscaleImage> outputTransformed, int decimationLimit)
      pyramidal median transform (faster than multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform but reconstruction from coefficients is not exact, so prefer multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform(...) if exact is needed); following pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -
      decimationLimit - a size for width and height at which to stop the decimation when the image is smaller than the size. The method does not continue to make decimated images beyond this size limit.

    • decimateImage

      public GreyscaleImage decimateImage(GreyscaleImage input, float downSampleFactor, int minValue, int maxValue)
      create a decimated image by using median transform to blur then bilinear downsampling to reduce the size. The parameter downSampleFactor is the factor to reduce the image size by. following pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh
      Parameters:
      input -
      downSampleFactor - the factor to reduce the input image size by (for example, size 1.5 would reduce the image width to size width/1.5).
      minValue - if result is below this value, value is set to this
      maxValue - if result is above this value, value is set to this
      Returns:

    • multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2

      public <T extends Image> void multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2(T input, List<T> outputTransformed)
      pyramidal median transform for decimation of input image. The algorithm follows pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh This method does not return the coefficients.
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -

    • multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2

      public <T extends Image> void multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform2(T input, List<T> outputTransformed, int dimensionLimit)
      pyramidal median transform for decimation of input image. The algorithm follows pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh This method does not return the coefficients.
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -
      dimensionLimit - a size for width and height at which to stop the decimation when the image is smaller than the size. The method does not continue to make decimated images beyond this size limit.

    • multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform

      public void multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform(GreyscaleImage input, List<GreyscaleImage> outputTransformed, List<GreyscaleImage> outputCoeff)
      pyramidal median transform for exact reconstruction. following pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh This method has a runtime complexity of n_iter * (O(N_pixels * 1.6) + 5*O(N_pixels)) where nIter = lg2(imageDimension) - 1 and N_pixels is decreasing in size by a factor of 2 for each iteration.
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -
      outputCoeff -

    • multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform

      public void multiscalePyramidalMedianTransform(GreyscaleImage input, List<GreyscaleImage> outputTransformed, int decimationLimit)
      pyramidal median transform for exact reconstruction. following pseudocode in http://www.multiresolution.com/svbook.pdf "Handbook of Astronomical Data Analysis" by Jean-Luc Starck and Fionn Murtagh This method has a runtime complexity of n_iter * (O(N_pixels * 1.6) + 5*O(N_pixels)) where nIter = lg2(imageDimension) - 1 and N_pixels is decreasing in size by a factor of 2 for each iteration.
      Parameters:
      input -
      outputTransformed -
      decimationLimit -

    • reconstructPyramidalMultiscaleMedianTransform

      public GreyscaleImage reconstructPyramidalMultiscaleMedianTransform(GreyscaleImage c0, List<GreyscaleImage> mmCoeff)

      Parameters:

      mmCoeff -
